I've never played the games myself, but I've read about and watched videos about them. I've got an interesting theory about the story of FNAF4.

To start with, I believe that the bite that happened was the Bite of '87. There's some confusion on whether the game takes place in 1983 or in 1987.

Second, It's quite possible that the bite victim is the Purple Guy's son, and the Purple Guy committed the murders as an act of revenge. However, he never saw who caused his son's death, which would explain why there were more than four murders. The Purple Guy hunted down anybody who was at the party.

It's also possible that the bite victim becomes the spirit that haunts the Marionette. In one of the minigame rooms, you can see pieces of the Marionette scattered around the floor. Also, looking at the victim's face in the minigames, his tears match the appearance of the Marionette's face paint, which may just be a coincidence.

As for the victim's brother and his friends, I think they die later, around the time of the first FNAF. They become the spirits that haunt the four animatronics of FNAF. The Purple Guy is clearly sick-minded enough to kill them, even if one of them is his own son. However, it's more likely that the four were so ashamed of what they did that they committed suicide.

That's my theory. If there are any inconsistencies, let me know.
